bestBHT.bht: The promise of the Son of man's glorious return is depicted as not being realized immediately, and the timing is deliberately left vague. This signifies the importance of patient anticipation and highlights the uncertainty surrounding the fulfillment of this promise. The second coming will only be seen at a specific time, emphasizing the need to wait patiently for its realization.

Archibald T. Robertson: As much as to say that it will be not till then.
Clearly the promise of the second coming of the Son of man in glory here is pictured as not one certain of immediate realization.
The time element is left purposely vague.
John Gill: And then shall they see the son of man,....

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse suggests that the second coming of the Son of man in glory will not happen immediately, as it will only be seen at a certain time. The promise of this glorious coming is intentionally left vague in terms of when it will occur, indicating that it is not a certainty for immediate realization. The verse emphasizes the anticipation and the uncertainty surrounding the timing of this momentous event.

The promise of the Son of man's glorious return is depicted as not being realized until a certain time, which is intentionally left vague. The anticipation and uncertainty surrounding the timing of this event are highlighted. The verse suggests that the second coming will not happen immediately, emphasizing the need for patient waiting.

The promise of the Son of man's glorious return is depicted as not certain of immediate realization. The timing of this event is intentionally left vague, emphasizing the anticipation and uncertainty that surrounds it. It will only be seen and experienced at a specific time, indicating the need for patient expectation. The verse conveys the message that the second coming will not happen immediately and underscores the importance of patiently waiting for its fulfillment.
